intro: Silene nemoralis var. pedemontana, commonly known as the Alpine campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its simple, often hairy stems and small, pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Silene nemoralis var. pedemontana is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
